utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah so I'm bringing in my year old son here with, I because he's had a fever and and a cough and a runny nose. These symptoms have been going on now for the last two days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Last two days. OK. Uhm, all of these symptoms have been going on for the last two days or just like one or two?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think, I think the cough and runny nose started 1st and then he then he kind of had some fever and had some chills as well last night. Kept saying that, like he was just cold, even though he had a had blankets on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. Alright, so the cough is it a productive cough or is it a dry cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Dry, OK. So no sputum, no blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no no sputum or blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any shortness of breath with that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, his breathing has been been good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, wheeziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. The fever, did you measure it yourself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did. Yeah it was 38 point, ah point 8.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the runny nose is it clear? Or does it have like a colour to it like yellow or green?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's pretty, yeah it's more clear.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Clear, OK. Alright and does he feel like he also has a stuffy nose or is it just a runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: More just runny. Yeah he doesn't mention anything about feeling stuffy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any symptoms like redness, any discharge?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, yeah, uh, he hasn't had any any eye symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about hearing wise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, hearing has been been normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And visions been normal?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It has, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any ear pain or discharge?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah, nope, no ear pain or, or discharge.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about a change in smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He he's been gaining weight, hasn't had any weight loss.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, he's had a bit of a sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: But he hasn't he's just kind of mentioned it. He said it wasn't too bad. He's still been been eating. Eating is that hasn't been eating as much, but he's got a poor appetite, but he, so this sore throat isn't bugging him that much that much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how about dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Numbness or tingling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Muscle ache or joint pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah he has had uh, he did mention that he just feels like a key a little bit all over.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in his bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Natural vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he hasn't had any nausea or vomiting.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm how about changes to his appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, his appetite's been a bit down, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Is he still eating solids?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He is, yeah, he's still eating solids just a little bit. Probably just just smaller portions though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah. And ah, are there any changes to his urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, there there hasn't been any any changes to his hearing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, any past medical illnesses or any longstanding medical conditions that he has?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he's he's been um he's been pretty healthy. Yeah, I mean, he's got got gets a cold every once in awhile maybe in the winter, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any hospitalizations or surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, he's been healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any complications with his mother's pregnancy with him?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's been ah it was normal pregnancy throughout it was to term and it was a C-section delivery but that went well and he was a normal weight.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And was it an emergency C-section?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah no. I think it was like Labor was taking, it was prolonged, I mean so it they ended up deciding to just convert throughout. It wasn't an emergency, but like they could have waited a bit longer they were saying but just kind of what went made the decision.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. And is he on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no he's not.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And developmental wise has he been hitting all his milestones for like motor movements, speech, behaviour, social, socialization wise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He has yeah, he's been meeting all of his milestones for that, for that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good. Is he up to date with his immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He is, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Does he have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any family history of lung or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, it his grandfather had high blood pressure and like high cholesterol, but that's that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And has he been in contact with sick, sick people recently.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I don't think so. Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And and any travel recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he he he's been doing some schooling, some schooling online and some some in person. And but, but otherwise they've just been at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, alright and does anyone at home smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No smoking at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And who does he live with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So he lives with myself as well as his his mom and then he's got a younger brother and a younger sister as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And at home. any reason to think that old carpet, dust, mold, asbestos, anything like that could be making his symptoms worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so, yeah, it's been all that's been OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and and those are all the questions that I had for you today. Did you have any questions of your own?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I I I just wanted to figure out what this was.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, so it sounds or actually I should start by saying we should get a Covid swab on him just in case it is Covid because some of his symptoms overlap with those symptoms of Covid. Umm, you should hear back in about 24 to 48 hours with the results of those swabs. And in the meantime, it could be another viral infection that's going around at this time of year. And from the sounds of it, you said he has a fever. He's coughing and he has a runny nose and has muscle aches. It could also be the flu. Regardless of what kind of viral and viral infection he has, the best way to manage it right now is just supportive care, so making sure he's hydrated, eating foods with a lot of nutrition and just keep an eye on his symptoms. If it gets worse or if it's very severe and he has focal neurological deficits like weakness or seizures, take him to the ER right away. How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds good. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
